GREAT news, Ogilvie Public Schools Families!!!

The US Dept. of Agriculture (USDA) and Minnesota Department of Education (MDE) just released this last Friday - the extension of our Ogilvie Summer Food Program through December 31st, or ending sooner if the funds become depleted.

This means breakfast and lunch for ALL children ages 1 through 18 at absolutely no cost to our families!

Yes--FREE MEALS for all children!

While your children/our students are at school - they will automatically receive these free meals, if you choose to participate.

If there are ANY OTHER CHILDREN in the community (not school-age yet) that you'd like to receive free meals for, please contact our Food Service Department at 320-272-5020. We ask that those ordered meals be picked up daily between 10:30 and 1:00.

For Distance Learning Students and Families, you will be contacted by the district for your meal planning.

For 7-12 Students in Hybrid Learning, please complete the following survey for meals:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSe2ZJRuIGUvCY12ECzjz9eA3mwSIqDLEGlvxn1HGC0Yp-9Kdw/viewform

Minnesota Department of Education
July 9 at 12:28 PM ¬∑

Thank you to the more than 130,000 families who took the time to complete our Fall Planning Survey. We heard your stories of challenging times and the hardship that distance learning placed on you and your loved ones. We also heard your gratitude for keeping our communities safe and spending more time with families.
Your experiences are invaluable as we plan for the 2020-21 school year during these times of uncertainty. It is our shared goal to lift up our students through education, while keeping them safe. Your voices will undoubtedly help us do that.
You can find the full results of our Fall Planning Survey on our website here: https://education.mn.gov/MDE/dse/health/covid19/publicEng/.
As we look toward the future, please know Minnesota school districts and charter schools are working extremely hard to support our students, families and educators. With your help, we will find innovative solutions to the challenges of our times.

If you see her, please recognize, congratulate her, and take note of what it takes to be an exceptional student and athlete, but most importantly an exceptional person.
